title: TimeStorm
subtitle:
7 years in, now is apparently not the time to talk about climate change, climate action, political corruption, cruelty to refugees, the failing economy, free speech  or how everything fair & decent about Australia has been eroded during the Abbot Turnbull Morrison govts.

title: John Vincent Basson
subtitle: This is a text for everyone with views on the present refugee/ immigrant crisis in the world. The facts of the history after the Second World War challenge us in the way we are behaving today. Those who neglect history live to repeat it. pic.twitter.com/IIsoJlI63f

title: ECCV
subtitle: This ECCV policy issues paper provides an overview of the multiple and complex challenges faced by Victorian migrant and refugee communities in accessing the NDIS and understanding the disability support system. Please read and share: http://ow.ly/1QSe50x7tc9 pic.twitter.com/hQGBefPkry

title: NAPHLtd
subtitle: It's International Day for Tolerance, promoting respect, dialogue, cooperation & tolerance of all cultures. On this day we're celebrating NAPHL's Refugee Health Nurses & the important work they do for people who have arrived in Nth Qld under the Aust Gvt's Humanitarian Program. pic.twitter.com/lndazrGdOy

title: The Pantograph Punch
subtitle: "I am a stateless Kurdish-Iranian refugee. Land is what is most precious for Kurdish people and that is what has been taken away from me". Portrait of Emad, a Manus Island refugee who chose sand as his symbolic object, by Hoda Afshar, 2018. On display at Gus Fisher Gallery. pic.twitter.com/ITjgyLuPcM

title: Dr Daz McFarlane, PhD
subtitle: Don’t be surprised if a boat full of refugees suddenly slips through the cracks of our defence, which will be Labour’s fault. Or a raid on the media or unions. Or perhaps - a happy dance off... pic.twitter.com/3fqJid8OiV

title: Claire Farrugia
subtitle: “She looks at the paper, looks at me, looks at the paper, looks at me” Trans people almost immediately fall into a system of statelessness when seeking asylum. Migration/refugee studies needs to account for trans experiences @Obsqueer #QueerDisplacementspic.twitter.com/Pa7u8i8MVP

title: Tyler Riordan
subtitle: @joydamousi suggesting to #AAHSymposium audience that until we formally recognise indigenous peoples, and truth-tell on refugees, #Australia has lost its moral compass. I tend to agree. Coming soon to @RadioNational #bigideas @HumanitiesAUpic.twitter.com/5xUBRA2CMT

title: Ingrid Mason
subtitle: Joy Damousi : Being Humane: A Contested History. The degradation of being humane in Australian politics. The treatment of refugees (Nades, Priya, Kopika, Tharunicca); no treaty with First Nations peoples, and breaches of international treaties. #AAHSymposium #auspol #AAH50pic.twitter.com/m6fxTj3SOQ

title: SSEAC
subtitle:
In #KualaLumpur, a #Rohingya #Football Club made up of #refugees and #migrants fleeing #persecution in #Myanmar, has become a symbol of #ethnic #pride for the #diaspora.

title: Evergreen Donation
subtitle: This could be your last chance to give a warm blanket to a freezing Rohingyan refugee. We will be departing on 15th Nov to distribute blankets to the adults and sweaters to the children in the chilly Rohingyan camps and remote villages of Bangladesh. Please dig deep. pic.twitter.com/mtUFIgSn5w

title: WEFTshop
subtitle:
